meanings.definition: The state of being without work or employment.
meanings.sent1: Her worklessness made it difficult for her to pay her bills.
meanings.sent2: The community was concerned about the high levels of worklessness in the area.
meanings.sent3: Despite his worklessness, he found joy in volunteering at the local shelter.
meanings.sent4: The worklessness in the economy was like a dark cloud hanging over the nation.
meanings.sent5: The worklessness of the city streets was a stark reminder of the struggling economy.

meanings.definition: The condition of lacking work or productivity.
meanings.sent1: The company's worklessness was evident in their declining profits.
meanings.sent2: The worklessness of the office was palpable as deadlines approached.
meanings.sent3: His worklessness in completing the project on time led to some comical mishaps.
meanings.sent4: The worklessness of the factory echoed through the empty halls.
meanings.sent5: The worklessness of the fields in winter was a stark contrast to their summer abundance.
